properties.name: config
createComponent
properties.defaultValue:
createComponentFactory({
    component: ModalWrapperComponent,
    imports: [RouterTestingModule],
    entryComponents: [
      StaticFooterEmbeddedComponent,
      DynamicFooterEmbeddedComponent,
      InputEmbeddedComponent,
      StaticPageProgressEmbeddedComponent,
      DynamicPageProgressEmbeddedComponent,
    ],
    providers: [
      {
        provide: WindowRef,
        useValue: <WindowRef>{ nativeWindow: window },
      },
    ],
    declarations: [
      MockComponents(
        IconComponent,
        ButtonComponent,
        PageProgressComponent,
        ModalFooterComponent,
        IonHeader,
        IonToolbar,
        IonTitle,
        IonButtons,
        IonContent
      ),
    ],
  })

components.name: AccordionItemComponent
components.templateData: {{ title }}

components.name: ActionSheetComponent
components.templateData:
<kirby-card>
  <kirby-card-header *ngIf="header" [title]="header" [isTitleBold]="true" [subtitle]="subheader">
  </kirby-card-header>
  <button
    kirby-button
    expand="block"
    size="lg"
    attentionLevel="4"
    (click)="onItemSelect(item)"
    *ngFor="let item of items"
  >
    {{ item.text }}
  </button>
</kirby-card>
<button
  *ngIf="!hideCancel"
  kirby-button
  class="cancel-btn"
  size="lg"
  attentionLevel="2"
  (click)="onCancel()"
>
  {{ cancelButtonText }}
</button>

inputsClass.name: yearNavigatorOptions
inputsClass.rawdescription:
Configuration for the year navigator.

Internally, calendar component:
- bases yearNavigatorOptions.from and yearNavigatorOptions.to on todayDate if a number is provided
- prioritizes minDate and maxDate over yearNavigatorOptions.from and yearNavigatorOptions.to
inputsClass.description:
Configuration for the year navigator.

Internally, calendar component:

  • bases yearNavigatorOptions.from and yearNavigatorOptions.to on todayDate if a number is provided
  • prioritizes minDate and maxDate over yearNavigatorOptions.from and yearNavigatorOptions.to

Saves a callback function to be invoked when the select's value
changes from user input. Part of the ControlValueAccessor interface
required to integrate with Angular's core forms API.

Saves a callback function to be invoked when the select is blurred

to integrate with Angular's core forms API.

components.name: FabSheetComponent
components.templateData:
<ion-backdrop
  *ngIf="actionSheet && isFabSheetOpen"
  (ionBackdropTap)="hideActions(fab)"
  (click)="hideActions(fab)"
></ion-backdrop>
<ion-fab #fab (click)="disabled || onFabClick(fab)">
  <ion-fab-button [disabled]="disabled" [attr.disabled]="disabled ? true : null" tabindex="-1">
    <ng-content select="kirby-icon"></ng-content>
  </ion-fab-button>
  <ion-fab-list *ngIf="actionSheet" side="top" class="{{ horizontalAlignment }}">
    <ng-content select="kirby-action-sheet"></ng-content>
  </ion-fab-list>
</ion-fab>

inputsClass.name: shape
inputsClass.rawdescription:
Determine outline shape of:
- list, if  is `false`
- section, if  is `true`

`square` means **without** rounded corners, `rounded` means **with** rounded corners.,  `none` means **without** padding, border, box-shadow and background.
inputsClass.description:
Determine outline shape of:

  • list, if is false
  • section, if is true

square means without rounded corners, rounded means with rounded corners., none means without padding, border, box-shadow and background.

components.templateData:
<ion-header (touchstart)="onHeaderTouchStart($event)">
  <ion-toolbar>
    <ion-title>{{ config.title }}</ion-title>
    <ion-buttons slot="start" *ngIf="config.flavor === 'drawer'">
      <ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="closeButton; context: { icon: 'arrow-down' }"></ng-container>
    </ion-buttons>
    <ion-buttons slot="end" *ngIf="config.flavor === 'modal'">
      <ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="closeButton; context: { icon: 'close' }"></ng-container>
    </ion-buttons>
    <ion-buttons slot="end" *ngIf="config.flavor === 'drawer' && config.drawerSupplementaryAction">
      <ng-container
        *ngTemplateOutlet="supplementaryButton; context: { btn: config.drawerSupplementaryAction }"
      ></ng-container>
    </ion-buttons>
  </ion-toolbar>
</ion-header>

<ion-content [scrollEvents]="true">
  <ng-container
    *ngComponentOutlet="config.component; injector: componentPropsInjector"
  ></ng-container>
  <router-outlet
    name="kirbyModalWrapperOutlet"
    [style.visibility]="config.modalRoute ? 'visible' : 'hidden'"
  ></router-outlet>
</ion-content>

<ng-template #closeButton let-icon="icon">
  <button kirby-button attentionLevel="4" size="sm" (click)="close()">
    <kirby-icon [name]="icon"></kirby-icon>
  </button>
</ng-template>

<ng-template #supplementaryButton let-btn="btn">
  <button kirby-button attentionLevel="2" size="sm" (click)="btn.action($event)">
    <kirby-icon [name]="btn.iconName"></kirby-icon>
  </button>
</ng-template>

components.name: PageActionsComponent
PageComponent

propertiesClass.name: navigationEnd$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
this.router.events.pipe(
    takeUntil(this.ngOnDestroy$),
    filter((event: RouterEvent) => event instanceof NavigationEnd)
  )

propertiesClass.name: navigationStart$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
this.router.events.pipe(
    takeUntil(this.ngOnDestroy$),
    filter((event: RouterEvent) => event instanceof NavigationStart)
  )

propertiesClass.name: SIZE_CONFIG

components.name: ProgressCircleRingComponent
components.templateData:
<svg [attr.width]="_diameter" [attr.height]="_diameter">
  <circle
    shape-rendering="geometricPrecision"
    class="circle"
    fill="transparent"
    [attr.stroke-width]="strokeWidth"
    [attr.r]="_centerRadius"
    [attr.cx]="radius"
    [attr.cy]="radius"
  />
  <circle
    shape-rendering="geometricPrecision"
    class="progress"
    fill="transparent"
    stroke-linecap="round"
    [attr.stroke-width]="strokeWidth"
    [attr.r]="_centerRadius"
    [attr.cx]="radius"
    [attr.cy]="radius"
    [attr.stroke-dashoffset]="_offset"
    [attr.stroke-dasharray]="_centerCircumference"
  />
</svg>

components.name: RadioComponent
RadioGroupComponent

outputsClass.name: valueChange
outputsClass.rawdescription: Emitted when an option is selected

components.templateData:
<ion-radio-group *ngIf="_hasItems" [value]="value" (ionChange)="_onChange($event.detail.value)">
  <ng-container *ngIf="!items || !items.length; else itemsTemplate">
    <ng-content></ng-content>
  </ng-container>
</ion-radio-group>

<ng-template #itemsTemplate>
  <ng-container *ngFor="let item of items; let i = index">
    <ng-container
      *ngTemplateOutlet="
        _customItemTemplate || defaultItemTemplate;
        context: { $implicit: item, selected: i === selectedIndex, index: i }
      "
    ></ng-container>
  </ng-container>
</ng-template>

<ng-template #defaultItemTemplate let-item>
  <kirby-radio
    [value]="item"
    [disabled]="disabled || _getDisabledStateFromItem(item)"
    [text]="_getTextFromItem(item)"
  ></kirby-radio>
</ng-template>

<ion-slides [options]="slidesOptions" #ionslides (ionSlideDidChange)="onSlideChanged()">

    <ng-container
      *ngTemplateOutlet="slideTemplate; context: { $implicit: slide, index: i }"
    ></ng-container>
  </ion-slide>
</ion-slides>

variables.name: TimeSeriesOptions

functions.name: mergeDeep
functions.description: Performs a deep merge of objects and returns new object. Does not modify objects (immutable). It merges from into object to the left eg. mergeDeep({a: 'will be overridden', b: 'some val'}, {a: 'new val'}) => {a: 'new val', b: 'some val'}

jsdoctags.comment: object - Configuration for how to merge. mergeArrays determines if it should merge or override arrays

libs/designsystem/src/lib/components/cha.name: TimeSeriesOptions

libs/designsystem/src/lib/helpers/merge-.name: mergeDeep
libs/designsystem/src/lib/helpers/merge-.description: Performs a deep merge of objects and returns new object. Does not modify objects (immutable). It merges from into object to the left eg. mergeDeep({a: 'will be overridden', b: 'some val'}, {a: 'new val'}) => {a: 'new val', b: 'some val'}

jsdoctags.comment: object - Configuration for how to merge. mergeArrays determines if it should merge or override arrays

libs/designsystem/src/lib/components/toa.name: MessageType
libs/designsystem/src/lib/components/toa.description: 'danger' is deprecated. Use Kirby Alert for critical events
